growing.water: Moderate, consistent moisture is key for tender growth
growing.soil: Rich, well-draining soil, slightly acidic to neutral pH, high in organic matter

planting.whenToPlant: Start seeds indoors 8-10 weeks before last frost or sow directly outdoors in early spring
planting.depth: Plant seedlings deep (up to first leaf) or trench and gradually fill soil to blanch stems

careAndMaintenance.pruning: None typically needed; remove flower stalks if they appear to keep plant tender
careAndMaintenance.general: Hill soil around stems or use mulch to blanch and produce longer white stems; weed regularly

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When stems are at least 1 inch thick, typically late summer to fall depending on planting time
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Lift carefully with a fork to avoid damage; trim roots and outer leaves
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks; can also be frozen after blanching

ecologicalInfo.pollinators: If allowed to flower, leeks attract bees and other beneficial insects
ecologicalInfo.wildlifeResistance: Moderately resistant to pests due to onion-like scent
